QuestDef.Description:
"My lord," the alchemist begins, talking to a farmer at a nearby table.
"It's me, Jerald, you stupid scitan." the farmer says. "The troll baiter is over there."
The farmer points in your direction.
"My lord," the alchemist begins, heading over to you. "I've an experiment and I need sand from a sand golem. If you would be good enough to procure some for me I can give you one of my pets."
QuestDef.SuccessText:
"What have you brought me?" the Alchemist cries, "A handful of dirt plucked from the innkeeper's garden? Do you think me a fool?"
"This is from the Sand Golem." You say through clenched teeth. Everyone in the inn grows quiet.
Even the alchemist understands that he is a few foolish words away from dying.
"Of course my lord, forgive me." He stammers. "Please accept this Ophidian as a pet, it will serve you well."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Collect the sand from the Sand Golem.

Objective.Text: Collect the sand from the Sand Golem.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: There is little of value in the ruins. But one of the temple's guardians still watches over his post.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the Alchemist

QuestDef.Description:
The innkeeper is admiring a set of gold coins on the bar. They are perfectly formed, and the inn's firelight dances across their smooth yellow surface, but there is no insignia on any of them. No nation appears to have printed them and although warlords or smuggling guilds occasionally mint their own coins they usually imprint them with their own symbol and never use such pure gold.
“They were made by magic.” The innkeeper says, “Pulled from the air as some conjure fire or wind. Can you imagine the sorcerer that can do this, he could ruin the economy of empires, he could raise armies of any size.”
“No.” you answer as you pick up and investigate one of the coins. “All things done with magic take power, and this power is more precious than gold. But still...” you say considering, “it is a good trick. Where did these coins come from?”
The innkeeper gives you directions to local ruin where the coins were found. The adventurer that found them claimed to have seen the words of a spell on the ruin walls.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will search for the ruins
QuestDef.SuccessText: The broken walls are carved with the images of a sorcerer crowned in jewels and tended to by legions of servants. There is little writing except for a single wall that appears untouched by time and elements. This wall has the Alchemy spell inscribed upon it.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the ruins where the coins were found.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: There must be magic in the ruins because shrills have been drawn to it. A group of Air Shrills scurry and clatter around the site seemingly without purpose. If you are going to explore the ruins you are going to have to defeat the shrills first.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You've defeated the Air Shrills! Now you can explore the ruins.

Objective.Text: Collect 100 gildar to pay the assassin

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
After you kill the Air Shrills you are surprised by a dark figure who steps out of the ruins.
“If you are looking for the coins, they are already gone.” He says.
“I have seen them.” You respond, “I've come for something else.”
“The spell then, it is of little use to me. But I will stand aside and let you go in and read it for a small price. If you will be able to summon gold, the least you can do is share a little with me. Say 100 coins, and I will need payment before you enter the ruins.”

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I am searching the ruins, I suggest you stand aside.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: “I had to try.” The man says as he steps meekly aside.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Very well, I will pay your price.
It isn't worth it, I will leave.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Explore the ruins.

QuestDef.Description:
Despite the warm autumn evening this area is covered in frost and a pillar of ice stands at the center of it. Inside you can just make out a hazy figure trapped in the ice. Etchings in the ice tell the tale of a man garbed in high priests, the servant of a titan who was seduced and betrayed his lord. The titan killed his priest and trapped his lover here for all time.
The ice is harder than midnight stones and you are unable to make even the slightest crack in it. You are about to leave when a hollow voice, as if echoing from a great pit, calls out to you.
"There is a way to break Utheron's spell. In his temple there was a staff that can free me. Please, I cannot bear another century trapped here."
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You snap the staff in two and for a second there is nothing but the roar of fire and blinding light. When it has faded the icy pillar is little more than a pool and a young man stands in its place.
"Thank you." He says. He has short, curly blond hair and wears a tunic that may have been stylish in another age. He carries a staff that looks to be made of the same ice as the pillar. "I cannot repay what you have done for me, please take this staff and you would do well to avoid Utheron. He will not be happy that you set me free."
"Many things have changed." You reply. "We are well past fearing the titans."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the staff that unlocks the prison.

Objective.Text: Find the staff that unlocks the prison.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: This ancient temple appears to be empty. But there is an item of value that has not been stolen, a staff lies upon an altar decorated with serpents and even from the temple entrance you can feel the heat emanating from it. As you draw close the serpents begin to move, hissing and bursting into flame.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the Pit of Utheron

Objective.Text: Bring the Staff of the Furnace to the Pit of Utheron
Bring the Staff of the Furnace to the Pit of Utheron

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: Get the Staff of the Furnace

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Break Utheron's spell
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "The staff and the prison are the same spell." The hollow voice explains. "If you break the staff I can escape."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I like the staff, I'm going to keep it.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You walk away as the hollow voice alternatively begs and curses you.

QuestDef.Description:
"This land is forsaken." the village elder says, "I have tried to form a village here, to provide care, safety and meal for the few that follow me. But we are little more than fatted calves for the bandits that hunt us. They consume more of our wheat than we do and eat more of our lambs. I have failed."
The elder considers his empty cup before continuing, "If you can stop these bandits, what remains of my soldiers will join you."
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You return to the village, but the news of your victory has already reached them.
"Thank you." the village elder says, "I was a fool to think that I could protect these people. We will join you if you would have us."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the Bandit Camp.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
It isn't difficult to track down the bandits and they don't stop you from walking into their camp and approaching the ramshackle throne of their leader.
"Speak," the captain commands, "or do you have a humble pie in your throat?"
"I've talked to the village elder and I've agreed to clear you from these lands." you say. "You can either leave or I will string you up for your crimes."
The bandit captain laughs. "Don't look at a gifted horse or it will never boil." The bandits around him begin to reach for their weapons. "Flee or I will make you as dead as a whistle."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You're horrible at cliches, I should kill you for that alone

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Slither away with your yellow tail." the bandit captain calls as you walk away.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the village

QuestDef.Description:
A woman stands unmoving outside her small home. It isn't until you get closer that you realize that she is standing at a crude grave. She doesn't say anything at your approach and for a few long minutes after. Then she spits on the grave, and turns toward you.
"What have you come to take, I have nothing left." she demands.
"I am sorry for your loss." you say.
Her eyes go vacant again, then she snaps back. When she notices you eyeing the grave she says. "I didn't know this one. Three men... creatures... came to my house and attacked my husband, Neville. He was a strong man once, able to take branches off an oak with one swing of his axe. But that was years ago."
She grows quiet before continuing.
"They came for him, not for the few pieces of gold we keep in the butter jar, not for our chickens or newling pigs. They killed him right here, and when they did one of the three fell down and died right beside him even though he hadn't been struck. The other two carried Neville's body away but left the dead one. I don't understand..."
QuestDef.SuccessText: You watch, half expecting the creatures to rise again, but they stay dead. As long as they are dead, they won't need this axe.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Track the Butchermen to their lair.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
There is howling coming from the cave, like an animal being torn apart. But the noise provides enough cover for you to slip close and look inside. There are three figures in the half light of the cave. Two that you almost mistake for corpses except that they keep a watchful eye on the third. They wear ragged white gowns and their skin is ash gray.
The third figure screams and chops at his own body with his axe, but his body is well past bleeding. As you watch he chops through his neck, stifiling his cries and finally dropping him to the ground. Then in a few minutes the screams begin anew and he rises from the ground like an old shipwreck being dragged off the ocean floor.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: If it is death they seek, I will give it to them.

QuestDef.Description:
An old man works outside his hut, scraping a wolf hide on a fleshing beam. A few other hides hang taut on a wooden frame nearby.
“You look to be a talented furrier.” you say as you admire the man's work.
“This part is easy,” he says, “the real trick is in enchanting the cloaks to protect from cold.”
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Would you part with any of these cloaks?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: He stops working and regards you. “I would make one for you for free if you bring me three wolf pelts. Or I will sell you one for 80 gildar.”

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will collect the wolf pelts and return
I will pay the gildar (-80 Gildar)
Kill the man and take the cloak
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: He doesn't put up much of a fight.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Wolves are common in forests, though they don't give up their pelts willingly.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You arrive at the workshop with 3 wolf pelts.

Objective.Text: Bring 3 wolf pelts to the enchanter

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: Welcome back. If you bring me three wolf pelts, I'll fashion you a magical cloak.

QuestDef.Description:
An old woman sits stirring the contents of a kettle on a large fire. Her hair is gray, long and unkempt. She wears dark robes that have had so many patches applied it almost seems like she is wearing a quilt. Despite the fact that she lives alone out in this wilderness there is a kindness about her. Her wrinkled face shows the lines of lifetime of smiles, not worry.
"Oh my, a channeler comes to grace my little home." The old woman says. "I'm afraid I don't have any of the finery you may be accustomed to, but you may have a bite of my ganoid soup if you are hungry."
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Thank you, I will join you
QuestDef.SuccessText: You pack the potion carefully in your bags. It will be a powerful tool when your champions are weakened by the wars that are coming.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The soup is… Well, not poisoned, and that's about as good as you can hope for. The old woman introduces herself as Lybbestre, a mother and grandmother who has outlived her husband, children and grandchildren. She is also a sometimes alchemist and claims to be able to brew a Potion of Restoration, a rare healing potion that removes all injuries, from Tilda Leaves. If you will bring her some leaves she will gladly make you one.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I don't have time for this

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: It is dark when you arrive at the field Lybbestre described. More than once you feel like you are being watched and a shadow seems to dance at the edge of your vision. Despite the ominous feeling you find and gather the tilda flowers without incident.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Collect the Tilda Herbs and leave
I don't have time for this (abandon the quest)

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You arrive at the hut with the herbs.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: If you bring me the Tilda Herbs, I'll brew a Potion of Restoration for you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
Lybbestre is excited by your return and thanks you for the flowers. She has already cleaned the ganoid soup out of her kettle and has what looks to be a thin, white cream boiling in it. She presses and squeezes the flowers until a small drop of oil drips from them into the kettle.
"There." she says, "Let me get a bottle and your potion is ready."
But when she turns the remains of a man stand before her, as patchwork as Lybbestre's robes. Dried blood covers every part of him and a sword has pierced his chest and still hangs out of him. He has broken off the hilt of the sword and uses it as a ragged dagger which he uses to slice through Lybbestre's throat.
"The potion is mine." He wheezes, and his words whistle through the wound in his chest with a sick hollow gurgle.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You will pay for your actions creature. (Attack)
I cannot kill that which is already dead (abandon the quest)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The creature greedily devours the contents of the kettle, burning himself as he does. After it is gone he simply lays on the ground beside Lybbestre and dies. Maybe it's a good thing you didn't drink it.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You collect the potion in one of Lybbestre's bottles and bury her by her small hut. But when you start to go you see the corpse of the butcherman begin to writhe.
"The potion." He gasps. "Please..."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: String the creature to a tree. If it cannot die the vultures can feast.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
He downs the potion in greedy swallows. Then his body shakes and lashes about as if lightning courses through him. He screams with a mix of pain and laughter, and when the screaming finally ends his body grows still and calm.
He says nothing, and doesn't reply to any of your questions. But when you turn to leave, he follows.

QuestDef.Description:
A group of wounded travelers has gathered here. They tell you about how a band of brigands has been terrorizing the local countryside by intercepting caravans, stealing their wares and then selling them to the highest bidder.
If only someone could put an end to the bandits...
Are you up to it?
QuestDef.SuccessText: You find a magical item in the bandit's stolen goods.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Track the bandits to their camp.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I am king here." The bandit captain says. "I will not stop taxing my citzens any more than you will stop taxing yours. And it is only by my grace that you are allowed to cross my lands at all."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: For now, I will leave you to your "kingdom"
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The bandits laughter echoes behind you as you walk away.

QuestDef.Description:
The air crackles with the scent of lightning, and arcane magic. An energy has now been set loose in the world, an energy that feeds the savage in man and Fallen alike, an energy that strips away the mask of civilization, and lets loose the beast within.
All players declare war on every other player they know, unless they are in an alliance
The coin and drinks are both flowing freely in the small inn. A grey haired bard has a seemingly endless variety of songs, from baudy Yithrilian rhymes to ancient Imperial ballads.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
The song drifts on the wind long after the bard has stopped playing. As music goes it wasn't very good, it was a simply harmony more than anything beautiful or elegant. It was the sound of insects in a summer field, or the tide against soft beaches. Everyone sits waiting afterwards, but there is only the echo until...
A shadow passes over you and you feel the dim rush of magic, excitement and fear that comes with the presence of one of Elemental's oldest creatures. While you stand in awe of the sighting, the dragon has ignored you, at least for the time.

Objective.Text: Return to the inn to talk to the bard
Collect 10 gildar to pay the bard

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You are complimenting the bard when he offers the following.
"These songs are fun, but I know of some that still have some magic in them. One is said to be able to summon a dragon."
"You can command a dragon with a song?" you ask.
"I never said control, he may land and kill everyone. I've always wanted to try it, but never had anyone powerful enough to protect me if it works. If you're willing to pay a few gildar I could give it a try."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll come back later if I'm interested
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "I'll be waiting here," says the bard, before going back to playing.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No, I don't need an angry dragon
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The bard shrugs and goes back to playing.

QuestDef.Description:
The moon has leapt across the sky, blotting out the sun. This is the black day; the day the priests of Ancient Al-Ashteroth feared above all others, for this new, unnatural darkness empowers the forces of chaos and destruction.
All monster player units gain 2 levels.
You run into a nobleman who requests that you escort his daughter back to his estate. He promises to give you an enchanted bow as a reward. What do you say?

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: You agree to escort the noble's daughter. He points to the location of his estate on your map, promising that his steward will give you your reward when his daughter arrives safely.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You failed to protect the noble's daughter and she died a most gruesome death. Her father will not be pleased...

Objective.Text: Don't allow the noblewoman to arrive unescorted.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The noblewoman's father is furious that you allowed her to make the journey home without an escort and refuses to give any reward.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
As you approach the estate, the family steward emerges and quickly looks the young noblewoman over. He sends the young woman inside before turning to offer you reward.
"I can pay you the 100 Gildar or a bow enchanted to fire flaming arrows. Which would you prefer?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Keep the reward, it was no problem. (+40 Influence)

QuestDef.Description: Inside the Inn is a frightened man. Seeing you, he says "My Lord, Brunthus the Tenebrous has taken over my workshop. If you can take care of him, I'll give you an enchanted shield I own."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find and take out the darklings terrorizing the workshop.

Objective.Text: Find and remove the darkling threat.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: As you near the workshop, several darklings peer out and sneer at you.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The darklings sneer.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You have freed the workshop. They offer you the metal or a well crafted Kite Shield.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I would like your metal. (+50 Metal)
Keep the reward, it was no problem. (+20 Influence)

QuestDef.Description:
You meet an old woman named Maggie.
Looking at you, she says "Ah, I admire what you are doing to bring civilization back to the land. To aid you, I have a magical ring that will make your enemies unable to strike you. Unfortunately, I kept the ring in a chest and the key I lost in the woods nearby. I can tell you where the key is if you're willing to take some risk."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find Maggie's Ring.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You find the location Maggie told you about. But the low barks of wolves can be heard as you draw close.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The wolves were drawn here by the remains of a camp. Searching the camp you find the delicate ring Maggie spoke of.

QuestDef.Description:
The sky is raining fire; rocks fall from above and sear the ground they touch. The screams of the dead and the dying fill the air; flames dance across the world like things alive, like the Anathua of old, the Fire Elementals worshipped in the House of Sirdir.
Random infernos placed in the world, all units take some damage, some ignys and fire elementals are spawned.

A wide-eyed young man approaches you, visibly shaken. "Rats, they're everywhere! They've infested my family's burial grounds! I will give you a Doom Club if you help me."
Will you assist him?
QuestDef.LongTextAccept: You agree to help purge his family's tomb of the rats.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Kill rats? I don't think so.
QuestDef.LongTextDeny: You deny the request, laughing at the trembling citizen as you continue on your journey.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: "You've got to get the rats out of the old ruin! Please deal with them so I can get on with my life!"
The rats gave you a few scratches, but you've cleared them out from the ruin. Return to the inn and inform the man that the deed is done.

Objective.Text: Bring the rat back to the inn.
The rats gave you a few scratches, but you've cleared them out from the ruin. Return to the inn and inform the man that the deed is done.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't have the dead rat yet.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You place the rat's corpse at the young man's feet.
"Your word would have been enough..." he says. "But about that Doom Club, it's not in good condition. Would you rather have some gildar?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Yeah, I'll take the Gildar. (+100 Gildar)
You had better pay what you promised. (Doom Club)
Keep the reward, it was no problem. (+40 Influence)

QuestDef.Description:
A wide-eyed young man approaches you, visibly shaken. "Rats, they're everywhere! They've infested my family's burial grounds! I will give you a Doom Club if you help me."
Will you assist him?
QuestDef.LongTextAccept: You agree to help purge his family's tomb of the rats.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Kill rats? I don't think so.
QuestDef.LongTextDeny: You deny the request, laughing at the trembling citizen as you continue on your journey.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: "You've got to get the rats out of the old ruin! Please deal with them so I can get on with my life!"
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
Rats flee the crypts in terror. You find a few in the crypts shadows, trapped in thick, wet webs, eyes wide with panic but too exhausted to struggle.
Deep within the webs something moves, something the color of drown flesh. The crypt isn't empty, and if you enter it unprepared you may not return.
Do you enter the crypt?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll not let creatures desecrate this ground. (attack)
I will return with more men.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: There were much worse than rats crawling through the remains of the tomb.

Objective.Text: Bring the rat back to the inn.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't have the dead rat yet.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You place the rat's corpse at the young man's feet.
"Your word would have been enough..." he says. "But about that Doom Club, it's not in good condition. Would you rather have some gildar?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Yeah, I'll take the Gildar. (+100 Gildar)
You had better pay what you promised. (Doom Club)
Keep the reward, it was no problem. (+40 Influence)

QuestDef.Description: People gather here to escape the wilderness, but you wonder if this is worse. The old and infirm lay dying, covered by scavenged strips of cloth or nothing at all. The weak work endlessly to rebuild the sparse tents and overhangs that are as quick to fall apart. Dirty pots sit empty and untended on burnt out fires, it has been days, maybe weeks since they were used to cook anything. Everyone looks at you with a mix of hope and fear.

Objective.Text: Pay 60 gildar to outfit the refugees
Pay 30 gildar to outfit the refugees

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: They were good people, once strong. With some help they may be strong again. They pledge their loyalty to you, if you would take them. What do you do?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Outfit them as Pioneers. (-60 gildar, gain a Pioneer unit)
Transport the refugees to your capital (-30 gildar, +20 population in your capital)

QuestDef.Description: All unit training is completed in all cities (first unit in queue only). Current research is completed.

A merchant has setup a stand here, selling or trading colorless potions to anyone who will buy them. A sign on his wagon reads "Enchanted Elixirs". When he spots you he quickly begins packing up his wares, but you arrive before he has time to store them all. Reaching down you pick one up, you can't sense any magic within it.
"This is what, simply water?" you ask.
"With a bit of sugar and grain alcohol..." the merchant replies timidly, "I used to be an honest man, but the world has no need for virtue anymore."
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Do you have anything else to sell?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I do have one item of some worth." He says, "A map to a treasure, though collecting it may be dangerous. I would sell it to you for only 20 Gildar."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will buy the map, it is wasted on you (-20 Gildar)
I won't waste my time. (abandon the quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Follow the treasure map

QuestDef.Description: The clearing is empty except for a long slate with a sword upon it. The sword is ancient, the leather grip cracked and faded, the jeweled pommel a spoiled grey.
QuestDef.SuccessText: The Assassin's Blade flares to life, so hot you drop it on the ground. When you pick it up the sword is changed, flooded with dark energy. Though its whispers are gone the power remains.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: A voice whispers to you, "I am the assassin's blade, enchanted to fulfill the tragic desires of those that wish upon my altar. Use me to fulfill those requests and I will seek your enemies as well."

Objective.Text: Seek the first victim of the Assassin's blade

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "A farmer came to me, his crops spoiled by blight and drought. He had purchased the seeds on loan and when the merchant came to collect payment the farmer's only thing of value was the thin livestock he needed to feed his family. The merchant took the livestock and slaughtered it on the farmer's lawn, wasting it rather than transport the sickly things back to his home. The farmer was then left to watch his family starve, he was near death himself when he prayed at my altar."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: It's time to repay the merchant for his cruelty.
I will not hunt men. (abandon the quest)

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: At the death of the merchant the sword warms. The jeweled pommel is no longer cloudy, the blade seems newly sharp.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: "The next is the cruel wife of a wealthy trader." the sword whispers, "Though she wants for nothing she inflicts pain on those that serve her. She has killed a half dozen of her maids and a stableboy barely past his eighth year. It was her son who came to me, too meek to end his mothers tyranny himself. Now the task falls to you."

Objective.Text: Seek the second victim of the Assassin's blade
Collect 30 gildar to bribe the guards.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The estate is heavily guarded, and though you can hear a woman screaming at her servants you have no doubt they would die defending her.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: They are fools to try, her execution is at hand.
Tyranny inspires little loyalty, I can bribe my way past the guards (-30 Gildar)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The guards accept your bribe and wander away from the estate.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: At the death of Mortessa the sword warms. The cracked leather hilt is supple and unblemished, the blade dances with an inner light.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: "The last victim is Petar." the sword whispers, "A husband and father. Another man desires his wife and with Petar dead, he believes he can have her."

Objective.Text: Seek the final victim of the Assassin's blade

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: It is easy to find Petar in the dingy village, he is known and liked by everyone. He sits on his porch guarded only by two content dogs.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I won't kill an innocent man.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The blade shatters with an inhuman screech. When the ringing in your ears has faded an angry demon stands before you.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The village looks on in shock as you slaughter Petar but despite their love for him, no one raises a hand to stop you.

QuestDef.Description: Within the inn, you find an old stagecoach driver. After some drinks, he tells you that he left his prize horse behind due to the danger and that you can have it if you can find her.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You have rescued the horse from the troll. It's really more of a pony, and it's an odd color. But it seems to like you.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the lost horse

Objective.Text: A troll is trying to make a meal of the horse.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: If you want the horse you are going to need to fight the troll for it.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will be taking that horse.

QuestDef.Description: You run into a nobleman who requests that you escort his daughter back to his estate. He promises a valuable item as a reward. What do you say?

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: You agree to escort the noble's daughter. He points to the location of his estate on your map, promising that his steward will give you your reward when his daughter arrives safely.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You failed to protect the noble's daughter and she died a most gruesome death. Her father will not be pleased...

Objective.Text: Don't allow the noblewoman to arrive unescorted.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The noblewoman's father is furious that you allowed her to make the journey home without an escort and refuses to give any reward.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive to find bandits camped outside of the estate. Their leader offers you a deal.
"There's no reason for unpleasentness. Simply give the girl to us and we will pay you twice what that undeor merchant will offer."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Sorry my pretty, a better deal just came along. (+200 Gildar, but abandon the quest)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The noblewoman bursts into tears as you hand her over to the bandits.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will not betray my task. (attack)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The Bandit Captain shrugs, "More money for us then."

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
After the battle the family steward emerges and quickly looks the young noblewoman over. He sends the young woman inside before turning to offer you reward.
"I can pay you the 100 Gildar or a bow enchanted to fire flaming arrows. Which would you prefer?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Keep the reward, it was no problem. (+40 Influence)

QuestDef.Description:
This farmhouse's fence is broken down and a cow lies dead in the field with a pair of bite marks nearly the size of short swords. The wound still oozes with a greenish white infection and the cow's eyes are forever trapped in an expression of terror and pain. Any other livestock that were once kept here are gone.
The farmhouse is so quiet it appears abandoned. But when you draw close a young man jumps up on the porch and grabs his spear. When he sees who you are, he tells you his story.
This farmhouse is his parents, and it was attacked by a giant spider. He and his two brothers arrived too late, and both of his parents were bitten in the attack. His father is already dead, his mother dies on her deathbed.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
The mother lives just long enough to hear that you killed the creature. With one long exhale she relaxes and her life slips from her.
You join the sons in burying their mother. After it is done and they have kissed her grave, they swear their devotion and lives to your service.

Objective.Text: Expend 100 Mana to Heal the Woman

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The young man takes you inside where his brothers tend to his mother. She is very weak but she tries to focus on you when you enter the room.
"Please, please kill that creature. Or my sons..."
She drifts off again.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
You place your hands on the woman's chest, for a moment you share her suffering. She is deep under black cold water, life grows ever more distant and wavering for her. The only thing that sustains her is her fear that the creature will return, that her sons are here, that it will kill them too.
Your essence, your spirit reaches out to her and pulls her out of the darkness. First it is no more than a gentle tug, then a yank as painful and chaotic as birth. At once her body spasms and she jerks out of the bed onto the hard farmhouse floor. A green ooze flushes out of her wounds and she screams. Her face goes flush, then an almost ash gray before beginning to return to color.
A few hours later and she is better, able to walk, eat and complain about the state of her ruined farmhouse, which she does with a fervor that would make a Trog solider blush. Her sons are both amazed and thankful for the miracle you have performed. In return they swear their devotion and lives to your service.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I have no time for this

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the creature that attacked the farmhouse

Objective.Text: Find the creature that attacked the farmhouse

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The house, somehow, still stands in the waste... perhaps because of the finger thick webs covering its every surface... webs that all at once begin to tremble as something from deep within the house approaches.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: Return to the farmhouse and tell the family.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the farmhouse

Objective.Text: You have kiled the Ravenous Harridan, return to the farmhouse.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description:
The mother lives just long enough to hear that you killed the creature. With one long exhale she relaxes and her life slips from her.
You join the sons in burying their mother. After it is done and they have kissed her grave, they swear their devotion and lives to your service.

QuestDef.Description:
"Is there any work to be had?" you ask the innkeeper.
The innkeeper considers, "Not really. There is a cave nearby that a few adventurers disappeared into. But we stay clear of it. I don't know that anyone would hire you to check it out, but the adventurers may have had something valuable on them."
QuestDef.SuccessText: Searching the back of the cave you find the remains of the adventurers.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Check out the cave.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The tree's around the caves entrance have had their bark stripped off up to nearly three times the height of a man. Paw prints in the ground are the size of a cows skull, and show deep gouges from short sword-sized claws.
Do you want to enter the cave?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No, leave it alone for now.

QuestDef.Description:
The innkeeper points out where the creatures broke through a crumbling wall into the cellar. Except for the stink and the collapsed wall the cellar is undisturbed. Upstairs, where the creatures encountered a very surprised barmaid, there was little left but broken furniture, torn drapes and shattered pieces of the odd ceramic dolls the barmaid pelted the creatures with. The creatures eventually surrendered to her assault and fled into the wilderness.
“I don't know what they were” the innkeeper explains, “maybe darklings, maybe small trolls. They smelled like an ogres outhouse, but they weren't very dangerous.”
“Then why hire us to deal with them?” you ask.
The innkeeper looks insulted and points to the stinking hole into the cellar wall, “Do you expect me to go in there?”
QuestDef.SuccessText: The innkeeper pays you the 100 Gildar he promised, though he plugs his nose as he does it.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Defeat the Skath.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The tunnel leads down a natural cave with a small underground pool on one end. You are about to turn back when creatures rise out of the water.

QuestDef.Description:
As you enjoy your dinner a merchant approaches your table. He bows so low he almost touches his nose to his knees.
"My lord." he begins, "There is a nest of dangerous Naja nearby. Right now they are few, but if they are allowed to raise their brood they will begin feeding on our pets, our livestock and then us. Please kill these creatures."
QuestDef.SuccessText: You find a young naja in the remains of the nest. You share some meat with it and it submits to you.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Clear out the Naja den.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The ground here is covered by dozens of waist-high piles of sand, each shaped roughly like an upside-down cone. On top of each pile lies a clutch of eggs, a half dozen of them have hatched. Tiny snakes heads appear from each, pushing forward...

QuestDef.Description: There is a dark cave here. Do you want to investigate it?
QuestDef.SuccessText: You have explored the depths of the cave.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The dirt floor of the cave is bare except for scraps of fur and dirt stained blood. But the cave isn't abandoned, a great wolf enters the cave behind you, followed by his pack.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Explore the Cave.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: There is a fissure in the back of the cave, leading deeper into the earth. Do you want to explore it?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You see a dim blue glow ahead of you. At first you think they are crystals, but then the come for you.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Searching in the darkness you find the remains of the last explorer.

QuestDef.Description: There is a dark cave here. Do you want to investigate it?
QuestDef.SuccessText: You have explored the depths of the cave.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The remains of a campfire are set in the center of the cave, the low roof is blackened with soot. Mushrooms grow in the shadows and a dark crevice leads deeper into the cave.
There is a fissure in the back of the cave, leading deeper into the earth. Do you want to explore it?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You see a dim blue glow ahead of you. At first you think they are crystals, but then they come for you.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Searching in the darkness you find the remains of the last explorer.

QuestDef.Description: There is a dark cave here. Do you want to investigate it?
QuestDef.SuccessText: You have explored the depths of the cave.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The remains of a campfire are set in the center of the cave, the low roof is blackened with soot. Mushrooms grow in the shadows and a dark crevice leads deeper into the cave.
There is a fissure in the back of the cave, leading deeper into the earth. Do you want to explore it?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: There is nothing but darkness at the end of the cave. You are about to turn back when you hear whispering around you. Your torch flickers in a nonexistant breeze.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Searching in the darkness you find the remains of the last explorer.

QuestDef.Description: There is a dark cave here. Do you want to investigate it?
QuestDef.SuccessText: The golem's body shatters. Two obsidian tablets are contained within it and they spill out onto the floor. They contain the secrets to the Shadow World spell.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: A small tribe of darklings are camped in the cave. They were fighting over a few scraps of rancid meat, but they drop it and look at you with greedy eyes.
There is a fissure in the back of the cave, leading deeper into the earth. Do you want to explore it?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
A grey giant lays at the bottom of the fissure. As if he has fallen out of the sky and the cave is nothing but the ruins of his fall.
When you get close the giant wakes and pulls himself out of the earth.
"The gateway cannot stand." the creature intones.
You have little time to consider its meaning before it attacks.

QuestDef.Description:
The inn appears to be closed. There is no oil in the lanterns, no horses in the small stable and no sounds of life. But the faint flicker of firelight reflects through dirty windows and you enter to find a few whispering farmers huddled around a table and a thin innkeeper who eyes you with a mix of terror and excitement.
You order dinner and get a disappointing bowl of porridge and a tepid beer. There is no meat on the menu and when you ask why the farmers are eager to explain.
"Something is slaughtering our livestock." "Whatever isn't killed grows thin and emancipated." "Emancipated? They are freeing themselves?" "Shut up Henri! You know what I mean!" "I saw a shadow cross my rooftop, the next morning my cows were too weak to stand. Three days later they were dead."
You quiet the farmers down and try to get a coherent story, but all they can offer is a mix of legend, gossip and questionable facts. If you want to find out what is happening to the livestock you will need to investigate it yourself.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You've defeated the Haunter and his diseased pets. You search the area for anything of value.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Discover the cause of the blight.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You find the barn, the livestock is gone or dead but something moves in the barn's loft.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Having survived the attack, you can follow the beast's tracks back to their lair.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You find the source of the attacks. A rotting glade haunted by dark shadows and echoing with ancient chants.

QuestDef.Description: After a good meal with the innkeeper's family you retire to your room. A few hours later you are woke up by the smell of smoke. You open your door to see the main room of the inn in flames. The rest of the inn's residents have already fled, but snake like creatures are dancing in the flames.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: I'd better slip out the window.
QuestDef.SuccessText: The innkeeper thanks you for killing the creatures that set his inn on fire. As a reward he offers you an axe an enchanter gave him a few days before. Though he warns that the axe may have summoned the creatures.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The ignys come for you.

QuestDef.Description:
The front door has been broken in and tables in the inn's common room have been overturned. All the food has been cleared out of the pantry and kitchen. There is a cellar door in the middle of the pantry that has been destroyed. You can hear the squeaks of rats from the darkness below.
You slowly go down the cellar stairs. At the foot of the stairs you see the body of a man, the rats are feasting on him and they glare up at you with dark, angry eyes. As you get closer they rip off as much flesh as they can manage and disappear into the cellar's shadowed corners.
You check the body, he has been dead for a few days. His blood has spilled out on the floor from multiple spear and axe wounds and has dried to the floor like a thin brown scab. The fight looks to have continued through the cellar. There is a short splintered spear, axe marks in the support beams and shattered barrels that were used as last ditch weapons. But there are no more bodies.
Outside the inn you find the tracks of wildings, their sand brute mounts and the shuffling feet of men, women and children being led away from the inn. The wildings took the inn's residents captive.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: We need to follow the wildings and rescue the captives
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Looks like we get the inn to ourselves tonight

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Track the wildings to their camp.

Objective.Text: Track the wildings to their camp.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The center of the camp is an odd pyramid of cages. Each holds a man, woman or child in various states of starvation. Those near the base of the pyramid lay at the bottom of their cages with barely enough strength to look up as you approach. Those near the top look to have been those captured in the recent inn attack.
A sand brute paws at the earth and warriors draw up in formation. They stand at strict attention, but don't move aggressively toward you. The only wilding that didn't react as you approached still sits at his fire. He wears feathers in his hair and a necklace of teeth.
“Have you come to buy?” the wilding shaman asks.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: "I have come to end you and free these people." (attack)
"Yes, I will give you 100 Gildar for your captives." (-100 Gildar)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: Pioneers join your army.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: "No, I will leave you to your trade." (flee)

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You have freed the catives. In gratitude, they join your army as a new Pioneer unit.

QuestDef.Description:
The inn is as somber as any you have ever visited. The innkeepers elderly wife has passed away and her body lays on the bar. Her family and friends are gathered around sharing drinks and memories.
As tradition dictates the innkeeper asks for pallbearers to transport his wife to a nearby graveyard. The locals are unwilling to do it.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I can serve as her pallbearer
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: The living need me more than the dead
QuestDef.SuccessText: "Thank you." the innkeeper whispers as he hands you an amulet, "My Solia will never be forgotten."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Go to the graveyard.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: All the graves have been dug up, and none are recent. There is a stone altar at the center of the graveyard with various weathered mementos and gifts around it. An open mausoleum is the only other thing in the graveyard. You place the innkeepers wife in one of the open graves and begin to bury her. As dusk approaches your work is interrupted by sounds from the masoleum. As you watch horse-sized maggot white spiders crawl out of the masoleum and come for you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: This job just keeps getting worse.
Run, leave the spiders to their meal. (abandon the quest)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: From a safe distance you watch as the spiders uncover the woman's corpse and drag it into the masoleum.

QuestDef.Description:
The inn echoes with songs, laughter and drunken arguments. The only quiet corner is occupied by an unkempt, grey bearded hunter who is sipping on his beer alone. After your meal you wander over to ask his story.
"My beautiful Varkana is gone." he says. "He hunted at my side since he was a pup, and he knew the forest as well as I. Three nights ago I heard the howling of wolves when I noticed Varkana had left our camp. The howls grew closer until I heard Varkana's yelp, and the forest went quiet. I searched all night but I never found any sign of Varkana or the wolves."
The hunter takes another drink from his beer. "If you avenge my dog, and bring me back his collar I will give you my bow. It has been in my family for generations and would serve you well."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Hunt down the wolf pack that killed Varkana.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Wolf tracks lead to cave, you can hear the howls of the creatures around you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Tonight the wolves become the prey.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: After killing the wolves you hear more howls, and the bark of a dog. Is Varkana still alive?

Objective.Text: Find the source of the howls

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You have found the source of the howls and the wolves set upon you. Varkana is with them, he has joined the pack.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Tell the hunter of Varkana's fate.

Objective.Text: Return to tell the hunter of Varkana's fate.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You return to tell the hunter of Varkana's fate. Do you tell him...

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Varkana was killed by the wolves and is now avenged
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The hunter thanks you for your help and gives you his bow. He invites you to share one more drink for Varkana.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Varkana joined the wolves and you killed him
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The hunters considers your story for a long time before commenting.
"Died as a wolf, I knew it was in his blood. I can understand the lure of the wild."
The hunter doesn't speak again, but you share a quiet drink with him and he gives you his bow in thanks for your help.

QuestDef.Description: A small caravan has made a camp here. They invite you to join them and offer to share their evening meal.
QuestDef.SuccessText: A flock of black birds takes to the sky as the Haunter falls dead. Searching the creatures body you find a magical item.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You spend the evening sharing stories and drink with a caravan of friendly merchants and guards. But that night you dream of death and fear. In the morning a fog hangs in the air so thick that the sun is hard to find in the pale yellow sky. The world is strangely silent. Strewn among the caravan are the corpses of the merchants and guards. They are grey and gaunt but without any visible wounds. Even the horses lie dead, still hitched to where they were tied last night.
You are untouched and you move among the dead quietly, with weapons drawn. The caravan made camp beside a crossroad and a figure in black robes stands at the center of it. A cowl covers his head and the only part of his body that you can see is a withered hand that he reaches out in your direction.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You run back through the remains of the caravan. But everywhere you run the creature is there to meet you.
You approach the creature slowly with an offering in hand. Once you are close enough your hand closes on your weapon, you will not give gildar to this abomination, it will have to take steel.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Give the creature an offering. (-10 Gildar)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You slip 10 gildar into the creatures hand. It accepts your offering and dissappears into the mist.

QuestDef.Description: Some scrap golems have mistaken a neighboring group of wildings for their ancient enemies. The wildings won't survive long against the attack.
QuestDef.SuccessText: The wildings cheer your victory, and offer one of their mounts as a reward.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: If the wildings are going to survive the attack, you will need to assist them.

Objective.Text: Get to the site of the battle.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The wilding warriors are already dead. There are only a few wilding familes still huddled behind fortifications.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: The scrap golems have outlived their use, tear them apart.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The remaining wildings cheer as you set upon the scrap golems.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: This should be amusing, let us watch the wildings be butchered.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You watch as the wildings consecrate their dead. In thanks the wildings offer you one of the fallen warriors Umbran War Boar mount.

QuestDef.Description:
A group of wildings are playing dice with some local farmers. The game goes badly for them and the wildings try to turn over a few hides and an old map to pay their debt. The farmers argue that the map is worthless. They are about to break into a fight until they notice you.
"Leave." you say, and both groups scurry for the door.
"The treasure map?" one of the Wildings asks.

"My fields are wasted." the farmer pleads, "My tomatoes are spoiled, my pumpkins never even started on the vine. Each time the ice elementals pass through their frost sets the plants back weeks. Someone has to do something."
Several others join in until nothing can be heard over the cacophony of complaints and demands. They all want the Ice Elementals killed. They have some scraps of metal they can offer in payment.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Travel to the frozen fields.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Frost covers withered tomatoes and cucumbers. Pillars of ice in various stages of melting are haphazardly placed around the field, one with a stunned hawk trapped within it. In the center of the field, surrounded by freshly formed columns of ice, you can hear the unnatural cackles of ice elementals at play.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You slip away before the ice elementals notice you.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The farmers celebrate your victory, and gladly pay you the 30 Metal they promised.

QuestDef.Description:
An old man sits at the campfire. He doesn't look up as you approach.
“May I share your fire?” you ask.
He looks up, wondering if you are mocking him. Seeing that you aren't he gestures for you to join him.
“I am Haitan.” He says, “Former failed smith, failed farmer and most recently failed summoner.”
“Summoning is a rare talent.” You say, “How is it that you had it, or lost it?”
“I had a staff and I could hear, I still hear, the whispers in the rush of fire. I thought I could use the staff to call to those voices, and it worked too well. A creature came out of the fire, but it no longer whispered. It took the staff and threw me aside.”
“I can teach you to use your skill, if you join me.” You say.
Haitan looks up, suspicious, but in the end he agrees.
“If you can regain my staff, I will join you.” He offers.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
Haitan looks at you in awe as you hand over his staff.
"My meager skill is yours." he pledges.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Recover Haitan's staff

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: A thick, acrid haze hangs in the air. You see Haitan's staff glowing in the darkness. A creature hangs over the staff, examining it but unable to touch it. The creature intones... “burn” but the staff is unaffected.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return the staff to Haitan

Objective.Text: Bring the staff back to Haitan.
You have killed the elemental and recovered the staff, return it to Haitan.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't have Haitan's staff yet.

QuestDef.Description:
You hear the problem before you can see it, screams and the pounding of an Ogre's hammer against the barricaded door of the inn. The people trapped inside the inn scream for your help, but the Ogre ignores you until you call to him.
"Huhrus hungry." the Ogre says. "Let me have a few and I fight for you."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Defeat Huhrus the Ogre, or let him eat some people and join you.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Do you allow the Huhrus the Ogre to eat the people and join you, or will you save those trapped in the inn?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I have enough people, losing a few won't matter.
I mean to bring civilization back to these lands, not allow creatures to run wild.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The innkeeper thanks you for your aid, but has little to reward you with beyond a hot meal.

QuestDef.Description:
Several villagers are arguing at the entrance to a pit. One of the rough walls of the pit has been torn part, a corner of the iron and wood grate that once covered the pit has broken through. There is blood and white fur at the edges of the gap, where something huge squeezed through.
It doesn't take long for the villagers to explain what happened. They held a garrote here. At first they claim it was to ensure their safety, but after you question further they admit that they used to fight the garrote for money. Sometimes against wolves or bears, sometimes against captured darklings, sometimes against companies of men.
Last night the garrote escaped, and now the villagers are afraid that the bloodthirsty creature will come for them. They plead for your help, and offer to pay you if you return with the garrotes head.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will hunt down the beast
QuestDef.SuccessText: The villagers are anxious to hear of your progress. When you tell them the garrote is dead they cheer and happily offer the sword they promised.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the Garrote
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: A few Slag are grazing in the area the Garrote passed through. If you want to continue following the Garrote's trail you will have to pass through them, which will probably provoke an attack.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The slags briefly look up as you slip away.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: This is not the lair of a wild creature. Though there is no evidence of craftsmanship there is a gathered nest of soft branches, a pile of rocks stacked to allow an easy climb to the top and tree branches stripped clean to let the sunlight through. It isn't civilization, but it is a place of quiet and natural comfort. You have entered the creatures home, there is no doubt he will defend it.

QuestDef.Description:
A young boy is searching through the ruins by himself. When he notices you he comes over and proudly shows you what he has been doing. He has been collecting butterflies. He has a glass killing jar where his latest capture, a blue winged moth, is breathing its last few breaths.
"You shouldn't be out here alone." you say.
"I will be okay." the boy says, "if I find a few more merchant Eblis will give me dinner and a better task."
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I want to talk to Eblis
QuestDef.SuccessText: When Eblin falls the butterflies are freed and in a flutter of bright wings they take off. You search Eblin's house for anything of value.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find Merchant Eblis
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
Hundreds of live butterflies and moths are stuck to the side of the house. A small man goes to each, feeding them from the tip of a wood needle.
When the man sees you, he rushes into his small shop and locks the door. He ignores you when you knock. The beating wings of the butterflies become more frantic as you consider what to do.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The merchant is gone, a twisted demon stands in his place.
"You should not have done that." the demon snarls.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Leave the merchant alone. (abandon the quest)

QuestDef.Description: Within the ruins you discover ancient glyphs. According to them, the ancient Sorceress, Moriah, could use mana directly as a weapon and shield. Her actual lost spell book is located within her tomb which is well hidden. After much effort, you manage to piece together where she dwelt while she lived. Your first task will to find the ancient village of her later days.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
The door to the tomb has been rolled aside. Inside the grave lies open and bones have been scattered about as thieves pried rings off of fingers and enchanted robes off of the corpse. Over the years animals have nested in here, as clueless as the thieves to the tombs real treasure. Around the tombs domed ceiling, in blue tiles so dark they almost appear to be black, there are another set of runes.
These describe spells both rare and powerful. One that allows a channeler to lash out with his stored energy and another that allows a channeler to draw that energy around him in a protective shield. With these secrets you have unlocked the Mana Blast and Mana Shield spells.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find Moriah's Ancient Village.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You arrive at the ancient village. No one has lived here in centuries. However, other, worse things, have taken residence. Very dangerous things.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: The village offers few clues. Just as you are about to give up all hope, you find a wall carving on one of the abandoned structures. The carving is a poem in the ancient tongue that gives directions on how well wishers could find Moriah's Tomb.

Objective.Text: Follow the directions to Moriah's Tomb.

QuestDef.Description: Your sleep is interrupted when a night watchman bangs on the inn door and calls for soldiers. He claims there is about to be a riot nearby and he asks you to follow him.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Go to the farmhouse.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The crossroad is alive with shouting voices and the strange warped shadows of an angry mob.
The local farmers are leading the protest. They are gathered around a former farmhouse, now marked with the symbol of Pariden. A small group of armed men defend the farmhouse.
"Are you so ignorant that you can't recognize holy ground? So blind you can't see that we are favored by the titans? So stupid that you would turn away their gifts?"
The speaker is one of the farmhouse's defenders, a disciple in blue robes surrounded by similarly garbed spearman.
One of the mob lunges too close and a spear pierces his shoulder. He screams and his torch flies out of his hand. The mob surges in and out as one, threatening to close on the robed men like waves crashing against an island in a storm.
"We have purchased this building." the disciple shouts, motioning to the farmhouse behind him. "It will be a temple to Pariden. And your threats, your fear and your ignorance won't stop us."
The air coils and twists around the disciple. For a second the mob struggles for breath, then the air rushes out from him and covers the mob with water. The torches are extinguished and the farmers are left drenched.
If the disciple expected that his spell would quiet the crowd, he was wrong. With their torches gone they turn to their clubs and knives.
"Do you want us to help keep the mob back?" you shout to the watchman that came to the inn.
"No," he answers, "I want you to help kill those disciples."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Defend the disciples and attack the mob.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You return to the inn. By the morning the farmhouse is empty and the symbol of Pariden is gone.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You have killed the disciples. You search them for anything of value.
After a few members of the mob have been beaten into unconsciousness the rest return to their homes. The disciples thank you for your help and offer you a gift.

QuestDef.Description:
You enter the tomb. The darkness is total except in the very center you see, floating in the air, a shield with the symbol of a great bird covered in flames.
As you head toward the shield you realize you are not alone!
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Time to get out of here
QuestDef.SuccessText: You take the shield. It doesn't take you long to recognize your good fortune. This shield will protect from magical damage as easily as it does from physical.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: All around you are various creatures of the dark.

QuestDef.Description: A campfire was built in the center of the old tower. It is cold now, but no older than a few days or weeks. Whoever used it is gone now and the tower appears abandoned except for an old man in a basement cell.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
After prodding him awake the old man squints at you through bleary eyes. “Are you the Dark Sorcerer?” though his voice is broken and weak.
Once he realizes that you aren't, and you offer some water to soothe his throat, he begs for you to release him. His name is Kainen and he was once a student of the Dark Sorcerer. Kainen traded his loyalty for the power of magic but when he could no longer stand the Dark Sorcerer's cruel and unusual demands he attacked him. The Dark Sorcerer easily defeated Kainen and imprisoned him here.
Do you free Kainen from the cell?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
"Thank you for letting me out." Kainen says, "I do know one spell that may help you."
(You have learned the spell Confusion)

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No, we have nothing to gain by freeing him.

QuestDef.Description: A campfire was built in the center of the old tower. It is cold now, but no older than a few days or weeks. Whoever used it is gone now and the tower appears abandoned except for an old man in a basement cell.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
After prodding him awake the old man squints at you through bleary eyes. “Are you the Dark Sorcerer?” though his voice is broken and weak.
Once he realizes that you aren't, and you offer some water to soothe his throat, he begs for you to release him. His name is Kainen and he was once a student of the Dark Sorcerer. Kainen traded his loyalty for the power of magic but when he could no longer stand the Dark Sorcerer's cruel and unusual demands he attacked him. The Dark Sorcerer easily defeated Kainen and imprisoned him here.
Do you free Kainen from the cell?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
"Thank you for letting me out." Kainen says, "But it's only the first of the many services you will perform for me."
As you watch the old man transforms to his true form, that of a demon nearly 12 foot tall.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No, we have nothing to gain by freeing him

QuestDef.Description:
There used to be nearby village, until a traveler brought an umberdroth to town.
After putting on a show, the creature went wild and wrecked half the town. Naturally the villagers fled for their lives.
The umberdroth on the other hand has taken a liking to the village. Clear it out and they'll give you their only item of real value, an enchanted sword.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: There may be an alternaitve to killing the Umberdroth if you can track down the man who used to own it. Do you want to track the fool down and press him to solve the situation?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: He's useless. I will handle the Umberdroth myself

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Make your way to the village
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You arrive at the village to see the Umberdroth camped out amidst the wreckage of the town square.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Time to reclaim this area from the wilds.
It's not the Umberdroths fault, I won't kill it (abandon the quest)

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: After killing the umberdroth, you travel to the village outskirts where the villagers are waiting.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The villagers return and cheer your success. They offer you either the enchanted sword that they promised, or an enchanted bow.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll take the Hunter's Short Sword
Keep the weapons, I don't require a reward (+50 Influence)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Track down the vagabond.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You find the Umberdroth's former owner cowering in a cave.
"I'm not going anywhere near the wretched beast! It nearly killed me, and all because I ran out of food! If you want to do something about the crazy animal, just bring it food. Half a dozen salted porks should get it in a more cooperative mood."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll get the pork from one of my cities.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Let's see about that salted pork.

Objective.Text: Collect 6 Salted Pork and return to the Village.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't have the salted pork yet.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Umberdroths aren't known for being cooperative. But this one purrs contentedly after eating all of the pork.

QuestDef.Description:
This shard is dim, quiet and set with runes that looked to be traced in shadows. Though there is no one here you can see the reflection of a dark sorcerer in the shards smooth surface. He is chanting as he moves, inscribing the runes and binding the spirits in the shard to his will.
The shard is useless as long as it is bound in the sorcerer's spell. Fortunately the reflection remains long enough that you can see the direction the sorcerer went.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will track down the sorcerer
QuestDef.SuccessText: The runes fade and dissappear from the surface of the shard. Voices, like the wind through a mountain canyon, echo out of the shard as it comes to life.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the Sorcerer responsible for enchanting the air shard.

Objective.Text: Find the Sorcerer responsible for enchanting the air shard.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You find the ruins of a temple. Inside there is what could be candlelight, but it seems the darkness is flickering instead.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the shard to see if the sorcerer's enchantment has been broken.

QuestDef.Description: Strange noises echo through an old ruin. Local legend tells of spirits that haunt the location.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: It is best to leave these things be

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Explore the cave.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: As you descend into the dark depths of the cave, the noises that sounded strange near the entrance are becoming clearer. In fact, you recognize the noise as the whimpering of a wolf. At the end of a long tunnel you find just that, a bloated she-wolf clearly struggling in pregnancy.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: Despite your best efforts, the she-wolf dies during labor, but now a litter of pups looks to you for guidance.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Kill the wolf before it can populate the world with its evil brood.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: After slaying the heinous creature, you scour the now bloodied lair for anything useful. You find a magical crystal and take it.

QuestDef.Description:
The inn is warm and full of good cheer. Wagoneers are playing a game of dice and you join them. Fortune favors you and you win an enchanted helm in the competition.
Later that night you dream of the helms last owner, a hero whose grave is a few miles away. He begs for you to return his helm to him.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will return the helm. Our heroes should be more than victims for graverobbers.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: The helm is mine now, he has no use for it.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Go to the heroes tomb.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
There are no tomb's here, and no sign of the hero from your dreams. You are about to give up when a serpentine voice calls out to you.
"You would steal from me?" it asks.
"I steal from no one." you answer. "I came to return this helm to the hero it belongs to."
"Fool." the dragon answers, slipping out of a copse of trees. "There is no hero. Only my spell to return objects that are stolen from me, along with the thief."

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: Searching the dragon's lair you discover some gold and a magical item.

QuestDef.Description:
"I am so glad you are here." the hunter explains. "Half my men were killed by a massive troll, the rest of us barely escaped with our lives."
The hunter looks like he can handle himself, making you wonder how tough this troll was.
"I can offer some gildar if you can avenge my men, and kill the troll." he adds.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: The troll will be dead soon enough.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: After what they have done to your men, no.
QuestDef.SuccessText: The hunter doesn't have the money he promised, but he does have an enchanted broadsword. You take it in payment for killing the trolls.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Go to the troll camp.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: There are no signs of battle. The clearing is generally quiet and serene outside of a troll warrior who is loudly chewing on the leg of a large, dark furred animal. Satisfied for the moment, the troll growls in your direction, then goes back to his meal.

As troll falls the hunter enters the clearing with his companions.
"I wanted to kill and rob you and the trolls." the hunter says, "But that seemed like so much work, this way you did half the job for me."
With a smile he and his companions draw their weapons.

QuestDef.Description:
Upon entering the camp, you're accosted by a haggard individual wrapped in bandages.
"M'Lord, our caravan is under attack! I rode out for help but no one here will fight off the trolls and they won't let me ride any further!
QuestDef.SuccessText:
On returning the horses, they make a proposal.
They'd like to set themselves up in your territory instead of going back home. If you build them a new residence and a stage to perform on, they'll abandon their current setting and move there.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Rescue the caravan.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You arrive to find the wagons surrounded and the surviving travelers holding the trolls at bay with sticks.

The travelers explain their situation. They are traveling performers who have been wintering in a small village. They explain that the surrounding countryside is getting far too dangerous to travel in.
Now they're in the middle of nowhere without their horses and would like your help in tracking them down, they'll give you their remaining coin if you can meet the wagons at the nearby inn with them.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Aid the performers in retrieving their horses.
Bid them a good day and continue on your way (abandon the quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Having worked out the general direction they fled in, you set about collecting the horses.
You've found the first horse
You've found the last horse and are ready to return to the camp.

Objective.Text: Bring the horses back to the camp.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't have the horses yet.

QuestDef.Description:
You find the entrance to an ancient dungeon, what was once the catacombs beneath the Ascian Temple. In ages past men barred, locked and enchanted the entrance to the catacombs. But the enchantments have long since faded, the locks have crumbled and the bars can be broken.
Putting your hands on the granite doors you feel heat through them. At first you think it is the trapped heat of the sun, but it is warmer than anything around it.
QuestDef.SuccessText: With the elementals gone you are free to search the dungeon for anything of value.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Fire explodes out of the dungeon, looking down into it it looks to be a great furnace, not an ancient catacomb. You are about to close the doors when you see something moving inside the fire. As you cover your eyes they rush out into the world. A few stay to punish you for disturbing them.

QuestDef.Description: Centuries ago a cave system was blocked off by placing a great capstone over it's entrance. Some suggest that whatever was dangerous in the cave must certainly be dead now and it could be a good time to remove the capstone and see if anything valuable is inside.
QuestDef.SuccessText: Searching the lair you find hundreds of dried husks. Most are decayed beyond recognition, but one thin corpse still wears a pair of black boots that are as polished and supple as the day they came from the cobbler.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Investigate the pit.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
There is a great hollow rushing sound as the capstone is lifted off the pit beneath. For long minutes there is only dakrness and quiet, then the sound of thousands of feet rushing forward and spiders explode out of the pit and rush into the countryside.
Do you climb down into the pit?

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: A hundred feet beneath the surface the pit ends in a large earthen chamber. The sides are beyond the range of your torchlight, at least until you see your torchlight reflected back from the darkness. First a few, then more and finally dozens of large wet orbs flicking wth light. Spider eyes coming for you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Place the capstone back on the pit.

QuestDef.Description:
You enter the tower to find a befuddled old man trying to piece together the shattered remains of what appears to be a giant telescope filled with crystals and mirrors.
"Vatula, you old fool." he mutters to himself, "Four years work destroyed because you let yourself be startled by that talking goat."
You look around for a goat, but there isn't one here, talking or not. Deciding the old man isn't going to notice you, you loudly clear your throat. He stops, looks at you suspiciously for a moment, then runs toward you in excitement.
"You can help me! I was going to use this device to scry the location of the fabled Cloak of Stars until that damnable goat."
Vatula stops at this and looks around the room, finally settling on an empty corner which he glares into until you clear your throat again.
"I can fix the device, but some of the crystals are beyond repair. Do you have any crystals I could use? If not there are a few Ophidian nests nearby that you could get some crystals from."
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will get the crystals and return
QuestDef.SuccessText: At first you suspect that Vatula was as wrong about the location of the Cloak of Stars as he was about everything else. But then you find it hung on a cloak rack as if it was in the finest Pariden tailor's shop. You take the cloak and leave before any other dragons return.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Gather 10 crystals.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
Vatula nearly bounces with excitement as he places the last pieces of the telescope together. Then, after looking around to make sure no goats will disturb him, he points the telescope to a random section of blank wall and begins looking through it.
"Can it tell you where the Cloak of Stars is?" you ask.
"Oh yes," Vatula says reverently, "I'm afraid it is in a dragon's lair. But do not worry, I have a spell that will kill dragons."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Give me that spell and I'll go get the cloak
You're a fool, get your own cloak

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The ground is scorched and blackened by lightning strikes, shattered by enourmous claws and the weight of one of Elementals oldest and most powerful creatures. A dragon dwells here.

QuestDef.Description:
You've come upon the hut of an old crone, withered with age.
Overlooking you briefly, she stops you in passing "You look like a capable sort, I'm in need of some medicine. There are some enchanted spiders around here, be a dear and collect their silk for me, I'm much too old to do it myself."
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You arrive at the old crones hut with the silk thread from the spiders, but she's gone and instead a beautiful woman is standing in front of the hut waiting for you.
"You've proven yourself a worthy leader by bringing this back to me. I apologize for my deceit, but I needed those for a cloak, not a cure."

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Gather spider silk from the surrounding nests.

Objective.Text: Collect the silk from the Spider Nest.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You find a path to another nest

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: You found a trail to another nest, but this one looks older than the rest.

Objective.Text: You found a trail to another nest, but this one looks older than the rest.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return the silk to Ariane.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't have the spider silk yet.

QuestDef.Description:
This dungeon appears endless. It is clearly ancient in origin, long before any of the current powers came to be. Whatever powerful civilization built this place is gone now.
Within the dungeon is vague evidence that it held creatures of terrible might. The walls are immense and there are deep scratch marks made by claws larger than any man or Fallen today.
Eventually, you make it to what appears to be an old archive room. The books that once lined the walls are long gone but the stone back wall is dominated by an inscription that you loosely translate as being "Destiny's Tutor". What this means, you cannot say. However, it describes an enormous structure that seems vaguely familiar to you. Your answer appears to be elsewhere.
